action.action-desc: Mr. Pompeo (for himself, Mr. Enyart, Mrs. McMorris Rodgers, and Mr. Kline) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To properly define and distinguish between decorative hearth products and vented hearth heaters.

section.header: Vented hearth heaters and decorative hearth products

paragraph.text: The term vented hearth heater means a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, or vented stove—

subparagraph.text: for which any AFUE representation, or representation with respect to P.4 efficiencies required for products sold in Canada, is made in any manufacturer advertising or literature;
that is certified to the ANSI Z21.88 standard or identified in any manufacturer literature or advertising as a heater-rated product; or
that is equipped by the manufacturer with a thermostatic control.

paragraph.text: The term decorative hearth product means a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, vented stove, or vented gas log set that—

subparagraph.text: is not certified to the ANSI Z21.88 standard and, in the case of a vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, or vented stove, is certified to the ANSI Z21.50 standard;
is sold without a thermostat and with a warranty provision expressly voiding all manufacturer warranties in the event the product is used with a thermostat; and
contains no energy efficiency representations other than P.4 efficiencies required for products sold in Canada.

paragraph.continuation-text: Decorative hearth products shall not be considered direct heating equipment for purposes of this part. A vented gas fireplace, vented fireplace insert, vented stove, or vented gas log set that is not a decorative hearth product shall be considered direct heating equipment for purposes of this part.
